trans-unit.source: Writes resources in an XML resource (.resx) file or an output stream.
The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> writes resources in XML format.
To write a binary resource file, use <xref:System.Resources.ResourceWriter>.
Resources are specified as name/value pairs using the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A> method.

Resource names are case-sensitive when used for lookups; but to more easily support authoring tools and help eliminate bugs, <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> does not allow a.resx file to have names that vary only by case.

To create a.resx file, create a <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> with a unique file name, call <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource%2A> at least once, call <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> to write the resources file to disk, and then call <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Close%2A> to close the file.
Calling <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Close%2A> will implicitly <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> the file if required.
The resources are not necessarily written in the same order they were added.
For more information on the format of a.resx file, see [Working with .resx Files Programmatically](~/docs/framework/resources/working-with-resx-files-programmatically.md).
This class contains a link demand and an inheritance demand at the class level that applies to all members.
A <xref:System.Security.SecurityException> is thrown when either the immediate caller or the derived class does not have full-trust permission.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes the resources to the specified stream object.
The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Close%2A> method closes the stream you specify as a parameter.
To write the resource to the stream without closing the stream, you must use the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method.
The output stream.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes to the specified <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object.
The <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object to send the output to.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes the resources to the specified file.
This constructor creates `filename` if it does not exist and overwrites it if it does.
If `filename` includes a directory path, the full path must exist or the constructor throws a <xref:System.IO.DirectoryNotFoundException> exception.
The output file name.
The directory specified in filename does not exist.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes the resources to a specified stream object and sets a converter delegate.

This delegate enables resource assemblies to be written that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] by using qualified assembly names.

Visual Studio and MSBuild use this constructor when you create resources for an application that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)].
The stream to send the output to.
The delegate that is used to target earlier versions of the .NET Framework.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes the resources to a specified <xref href="System.IO.TextWriter"></xref> object and sets a delegate that enables resource assemblies to be written that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] by using qualified assembly names.

Visual Studio and MSBuild use this constructor when you create resources for an application that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)].
The object to send output to.
The delegate that is used to target earlier versions of the .NET Framework.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> class that writes the resources to a specified file and sets a delegate that enables resource assemblies to be written that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)] by using qualified assembly names.

Visual Studio and MSBuild use this constructor when you create resources for an application that target versions of the .NET Framework before the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)].
The file to send output to.
The delegate that is used to target earlier versions of the .NET Framework.
The directory specified in filename does not exist.
Adds the specified alias to a list of aliases.
Resources whose values are from an aliased assembly are automatically added to the list of aliases.
The resource is not written until <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> is called.
The name of the alias.
The name of the assembly represented by aliasName.
assemblyName is `null`.
Adds a design-time property whose value is specifed as a byte array to the list of resources to write.
The name of a property.
A byte array containing the value of the property to add.
The resource specified by the name parameter has already been added.
Adds a design-time property whose value is specified as an object to the list of resources to write.
The name of a property.
An object that is the value of the property to add.
The resource specified by the name parameter has already been added.
Adds a design-time property whose value is specified as a string to the list of resources to write.
The name of a property.
A string that is the value of the property to add.
The resource specified by the name property has already been added.
Adds a named resource specified as an object to the list of resources to write.
The resource is not written until <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> is called.
The resource that was added must be serializable.
If the resource being added is a string, it is written as a string; otherwise, the resource is serialized and stored in a binary format.
The name of the resource.
The value of the resource.
Adds a string resource to the resources.
The resource is not written until <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> is called.
The name of the resource.
The value of the resource.
Adds a named resource specified in a <xref href="System.Resources.ResXDataNode"></xref> object to the list of resources to write.
A <xref href="System.Resources.ResXDataNode"></xref> object that contains a resource name/value pair.
Adds a named resource specified as a byte array to the list of resources to write.
The resource is not written until <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> is called.
The resource is serialized and stored in a binary format.
The name of the resource.
The value of the resource to add as an 8-bit unsigned integer array.
Gets or sets the base path for the relative file path specified in a <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> object.
A path that, if prepended to the relative file path specified in a <xref href="System.Resources.ResXFileRef"></xref> object, yields an absolute path to an XML resource file.
Specifies the default content type for a binary object.
This field is read-only.
Specifies the default content type for a byte array object.
This field is read-only.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref>.
Calling this method is the equivalent of calling <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A>.
Specifies the default content type for an object.
This field is read-only.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method, if necessary, before releasing managed and unmanaged system resources.
Calling <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A> allows the system resources used by the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> to be reallocated for other purposes.
For more information about <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A>, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md).
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter"></xref> and optionally releases the managed resources.

The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method, if necessary, before releasing managed and unmanaged system resources.
This method is called by the public <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Dispose%2A> method and the <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
`Dispose()` invokes the protected `Dispose(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`.
When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter> references.
This method invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
This member overrides the <xref href="System.Object.Finalize"></xref> method.
Writes all resources added by the <xref href="System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.AddResource(System.String,System.Byte[])"></xref> method to the output file or stream.
The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method writes the resources to the output file or stream.
If you want to write the resources as well as close the output file or stream, call the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Close%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method can be called only once.

After calling the <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Generate%2A> method, all <xref:System.Resources.IResourceWriter> methods other than <xref:System.Resources.ResXResourceWriter.Close%2A> will throw an exception.
The resource has already been saved.
Specifies the content type of an XML resource.
This field is read-only.
Specifies the schema to use in writing the XML file.
This field is read-only.
The schema provides details on how to encode the resources based on the type of resource being written.
Specifies the content type for a SOAP object.
This field is read-only.
Specifies the version of the schema that the XML output conforms to.
This field is read-only.
